title: The formulative evaluation of the 5/99 Programme and its broader environment: the EDNER project
abstract:
No full-text of this article is available; article can be accessed via additional link.

rawRecordXml:
<record><header><identifier>
oai:www.e-space.mmu.ac.uk:2173/1508</identifier><datestamp>2007-03-21T13:34:47Z</datestamp><setSpec>hdl_2173_670</setSpec><setSpec>hdl_2173_682</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd" ><dc:title>The formulative evaluation of the 5/99 Programme and its broader environment: the EDNER project</dc:title><dc:creator>Brophy, Peter</dc:creator><dc:subject>Information retrieval</dc:subject><dc:subject>Information systems</dc:subject><dc:subject>Learning</dc:subject><dc:subject>Performance appraisal</dc:subject><dc:subject>User studies</dc:subject><dc:description>Purpose: This paper proposes investigating the JISC 5/99 Programme and the developing
Information Environment.
Design/methodology/approach: The paper reports on the experience of undertaking a three-year
formative evaluation of the JISC 5/99 Programme and the developing Information Environment,
reflects on the methodologies which were chosen and considers the ways in which the evaluation team
engaged with projects and other stakeholders.
Findings: The paper finds that an emphasis on outcomes and impacts helped the Programme to
focus its activities. The paper includes reflective conclusions concerning the experiences of students,
tutors and others involved in using networked information services in support of learning.
Originality/value: The paper is useful to those wishing to make use of the Information
Environment.</dc:description><dc:description>No full-text of this article is available; article can be accessed via additional link.
